category_id: Equipment: Rental and Leasing Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Under-Bridge Inspection Truck (UBIT) Rental
description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This solicitation is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ) and the solicitation number for this requirement 12443922Q0025.?? This procurement is issued for 100% Small Business Set-Aside. The associated NAICS code is 532490. The small business size standard is $35.0 million. The Contractor shall provide Under-Bridge inspection truck (UBIT) rental including all travel, labor, materials, and supplies to necessary to conduct fracture critical bridge inspections over a period of 10 days located at various locations on the National Forest in NC, George Washington & Jefferson National Forests in VA, and the Ouachita and Ozark National Forests in AR.?? The estimated date for starting work will be on or after June 15, 2022. All quotations shall be submitted electronically no later June 8, 2022, at 5:00 pm, Eastern Time, to the Contract Specialist: Chandria.Fulghum@usda.gov. If you have any questions, please contact Chandria no later than Tuesday, June 3, 2022, 5:00pm, eastern time. ????? All interested firms are advised that registration in the System for Award Management (SAM) is required to eligible for award of contract.? For more information, please check the SAM website at https://www.sam.gov.? Registration in SAM is free.?

category_id: Equipment: Rental and Leasing Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Lease/Rental: Temporary Living Quarters
description: This is a Request for Information (RFI)/Sources Sought. There is no solicitation at this time. This request for capability information does not constitute a Request for Quotes (RFQ). Submission of any information in response to this market survey is purely voluntary; the Government assumes no financial responsibility for any information or costs incurred. All costs associated with responding to this notice will be solely at the interested party's expense. Not responding to this notice does not preclude participation in any future RFQ, if any is issued. 1.0 PURPOSE OF THE RFI The 144th Fighter Wing (FW) is issuing this sources sought as a means of conducting market research to identify parties having an interest in and the resources to meet our requirement for the lease/rental of temporary on-site living quarters. The result of this market research will contribute to determining the method of procurement. 2.0 BACKGROUND: Temporary on-site living quarters are required for the temporary relocation of 144th Detachment-1 alert operations. Alert operations are conducted 24/7 with six (6) on-site employees who must be located within close proximity at all times. The employees consist of 4 maintainers and 2 aircrew personnel. 3.0 DESCRIPTION: Anticipated Start Date: 01 August 2022 Place of Performance: Joint Forces Training Base, Los Alamitos, CA 90720 Period of Performance: 60 days The temporary living solution(s) should include the following: 6 separate bedrooms with area for kitchen and bathroom. May be 6 individual units or 2 living quarters as defined below: Possible solutions may include 6 recreational vehicles or 2 living quarters (mobile/construction trailer design). One unit would be for aircrew with one communal area and two separate bedrooms. The other unit would be for maintenance personnel with one communal area and 4 separate bedrooms. Units must have a window for egress and meet California fire code. *Beds are optional. Inform us if beds are included within each unit or communal living area? Bathroom: (Specify if private bathrooms, communal bathroom within each living quarters, or separate bathroom facility). Bathroom should have the following. Explain if not met. Toilet Shower Sink Kitchen facility (Specify if private kitchen, communal kitchen within each living quarters, or separate kitchen facility). Kitchen facility should have the following. Explain if not met. Stove/Oven Sink Refrigerator w/ freezer *Microwave is optional. Are microwaves included within each unit or communal living area? Water heater Potable water tank and black/grey waste storage tanks* *Please specify if potable water and waste treatment services are also offered? Air conditioning Electrical/Generator hook-ups, outlets, and lighting Satellite Television hook-ups* *Desired, but not required. Please specify if capable of offering. Television(s)* *Desired, but not required. Please specify if capable of offering. 4.0 HOW TO RESPOND: Responses to this Sources Sought notice do not bind the Government to any agreement with the responder, be it explicit or implied. Respond to the attached capability question. Please send responses via e-mail with ?ATTN: 144FW DET-1 Temporary Living Quarters? in the subject line to: 144.FW.FAL.MSC.Contracting@us.af.mil 5.0 MISCELLANEOUS: Proprietary information and trade secrets, if any, must be clearly marked on all materials. All responses should be submitted electronically using PDF, HTML, MS Word or PowerPoint formats. *ONLY written responses will be accepted. *Total e-mail file limit size is restricted to 15MB. *Telephone inquiries will not be accepted or acknowledged, and no feedback or evaluations will be provided to companies regarding their submissions.

description: The intent of this solicitation is to obtain quotes for Off-Highway Vehicles (OHV) in order to implement multiple Incident-Blanket Purchase Agreements (I-BPA) for use on a local, Regional and Nationwide fire suppression and all-hazard incidents. OHV is a general category which includes, All-Terrain Vehicles (ATV), Multipurpose Off-Highway Utility Vehicles (MOHUV), and Recreational Off-Road Vehicles (ROV). ? Set Aside: 100% small business set-aside. Provide quote by 1700 hours, Eastern Time on Wednesday, June 8th, 2022. Submit a quote by sending an email to?sm.fs.woaims@usda.gov. You must have the solicitation number, 1202RZ22Q0004, in the subject line of the email. (See E.1 52.212-1 Instructions to Offeror in Section E). ?All supporting documents shall be submitted in a single .pdf file as an attachment to the submission email. Faxed quotes will not be accepted.

description: This is a?COMBINED SYNOPSIS/SOLICITATION?for commercial items prepared in accordance with the information in FAR Subpart 12, using Simplified Acquisition Procedures, as supplemented with the additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; a written solicitation will not be issued. Paper copies of this solicitation will not be available. This combined synopsis/solicitation shall be posted on BETA SAM. The Request for Quotation (RFQ) number is?N3904021QPSE1723. This solicitation documents and incorporates provisions and clauses in effect through FAC 2020-05 and DFARS Change Notice?2021-04 1-19-2021. It is the responsibility of the contractor to be familiar with the applicable clauses and provisions. The clauses may be accessed in full text at these addresses: https://www.acquisition.gov/browse/index/far ?and?https://www.acq.osd.mil/dpap/dars/change_notices.html The NAICS code is?532490?and the Small Business Standard is $35 million. This is a?100% SMALL BUSINESS SET-ASIDE?solicitation. Written quotes are required (oral offers will not be accepted). Quotes will be received by email only.? title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): W--Two (2) 40?Foot x 100? Foot tents (for overhead cover)
description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is W911SD-22-R-0114_01 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 532289 with a small business size standard of $7.50M. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified sellers may submit bids. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-06-03 12:00:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be West Point, NY 10996 The MICC West Point requires the following items, Meet or Exceed, to the following: LI 001: Tent- A portable shelter, supported by poles. 40?Foot x 100? Foot tents (for overhead cover) To be erected in the parking lot area in front of LRC Bldg 917 located on West Point From 24 June 2022 to 05 July 2022. No sides. No A/C, no additional amenities Set up date: 24 June Tear down date: 05 July, 2, EA; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested Offerers must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, MICC West Point intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. MICC West Point is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerers that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerers that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerers that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerers may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should Offerers require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. New Equipment ONLY; NO remanufactured or "gray market" items. All items must be covered by the manufacturer's warranty. Bid MUST be good for 60 calendar days after close of Buy. Shipping must be free on board (FOB) destination CONUS (Continental U.S.), which means that the seller must deliver the goods on its conveyance at the destination specified by the buyer, and the seller is responsible for the cost of shipping and risk of loss prior to actual delivery at the specified destination. This solicitation requires registration with the System for Award Management (SAM) at the time an offer or quotation is submitted, excluding the exceptions outlined in FAR 4.1102(a). Registration information can be found at www.sam.gov. No partial shipments are permitted unless specifically authorized at the time of award. The selected Offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions, which are incorporated herein by reference: FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition; FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications - Commercial Items - the selected offeror must submit a completed copy of the listed representations and certifications; FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items; FAR 52.212-5 (DEV), Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, and the following clauses: 52.219-28, 52.222-19, 52.222-21, 52.22-22, 52.222-26, 52.222-35, 52.222-36, 52.222-37, 52.222-50, 52.225-13, 52.232-34, 52.232-99 (DEV), 52.233-4 and DFAR 252.212-7001, 252.232-7003, 252.232-7010, 252.232-7006 and 252.209-7999. The full text of the referenced FAR clauses may be accessed electronically at http://farsite.hill.af.mil/VFFAR1.htm

AMC-Level Protest Program If you have complaints about this procurement, it is preferable that you first attempt to resolve those concerns with the responsible contracting officer. However, you can also protest to Headquarters (HQ), Army Materiel Command (AMC). The HQ AMC-Level Protest Program is intended to encourage interested parties to seek resolution of their concerns within AMC as an Alternative Dispute Resolution forum, rather than filing a protest with the Government Accountability Office (GAO) or other external forum. Contract award or performance is suspended during the protest to the same extent, and within the same time periods, as if filed at the GAO. The AMC protest decision goal is to resolve protests within 20 working days from filing. To be timely, protests must be filed within the periods specified in FAR 33.103. If you want to file a protest under the HQ AMC-Level Protest Program, the protest must request resolution under that program and be sent to the address below. All other agency-level protests should be sent to the contracting officer for resolution. Headquarters U.S. Army Materiel Command Office of Command Counsel 4400 Martin Road Rm: A6SE040.001 Redstone Arsenal, AL 35898-5000 Fax: (256) 450-8840 Packages sent by FedEx or UPS should be addressed to: Headquarters U.S. Army Materiel Command Office of Command Counsel 4400 Martin Road Rm: A6SE040.001 Redstone Arsenal, AL 35898-5000 Fax: (256) 450-8840 The AMC-Level Protest procedures are found at: http://www.amc.army.mil/pa/COMMANDCOUNSEL.asp. If internet access is not available, contact the contracting officer or HQ, AMC to obtain the HQ AMC-Level Protest Procedures. 52.204-9, Personal Identity Verification of Contractor Personnel; 52.204-10, Reporting Executive Compensation and First-Tier Subcontract Awards; 52.222-41, Service Contract Act; 52.237-2, Protection of Government Buildings, Equipment and Vegetation; 252.201-7000, COR Clause; 252.223-7006, Prohibition On Storage And Disposal Of Toxic And Hazardous Materials; 252.243-7001, Pricing of Contract Modifications; 252.246-7000, Material inspection and receiving report Representation by Corporations Regarding an Unpaid Tax Liability or a Felony Conviction under any Federal Law. Wide Area WorkFlow Payment Instructions 252.204-7012 Safeguarding of Unclassified Controlled Technical Information All deliveries shall be palletized when the material exceeds 250 lbs. (excluding the pallet), or exceeds 20 cubic feet, to comply with the requirements of Department of the Army Pamphlet 700-32 and MIL-STD-147E.

description: NC State University’s Athletics Department seeks proposals from qualified suppliers (hereafter referred to as contractor) to provide the rental of portable toilets (Port-A-Johns) for Carter Finley Stadium football games and other events held at the facility. The Contractor shall provide delivery, setup and relocating as needed, maintenance (dumping, cleaning, deodorizing etc.) of the units, and removal at the end of the season. The University requires that the units be delivered to the designated location(s) prior to the first football game and kept on property until after the final football game in December.

category_id: Equipment: Rental and Leasing Bids
title: 501 CSW Vehicle Lease IDIQ
description: SOURCE SOUGHT SYNOPSIS (Not a Notice of Solicitation)? FA557022Q1003 The United States Air Force, 501 Combat Support Wing, Regional Contracting Office, RAF Alconbury, United Kingdom is seeking capabilities packages of potential sources, that are capable of providing vehicle leasing services at RAF Alconbury, RAF Fairford, RAF Molesworth, RAF Digby, and RAF Croughton.? Firms should provide detailed infromation to show clear technical compliance with the attached Draft Performance Work Statement.?Estimated period of performance is August 2022 through July 2027. Multiple performance and delivery locations exist across the United Kingdom.? At this time a firm fixed price Indefinite Delivery, Indefinite Quanity is contemplated for this effort but is submit to change in response to this notice.? All interested firms shall submit a response demonstrating their capability to provide the requested services to the Primary Point?of Contact listed below. As stipulated in FAR 15.201, responses to this notice are not considered offers and cannot be accepted by the Government to form a binding contract. No solicitation (Request for Quotes) exists; therefore, do not request a copy of the solicitation. The decision to solicit for a contract shall be solely within the Government's discretion.?? Any information submitted by respondents to this sources sought synopsis is voluntary. This sources sought notice is not to be construed as a commitment by the Government, nor will the Government reimburse any costs associated with the submission of information in response to this notice. Respondents will not be individually notified of the results of any Government assessments. The Government's assessment of the capability statements received will factor into whether any forthcoming solicitation will be conducted as a full and open competition or as a local area set-aside.? ? Interested firms are encouraged to provide feedback regarding the Attached Draft Performance Work Statement. Responses detailing innovative and cost saving methods to meeting the governments objectives set forth in the Draft Performance Work Statement are highly encouraged and requested by the government.?? All interested firms must be registered in System for Award Management (SAM) to be eligible for award of any subsequent contract resulting from this notice. Should you have?any questions regarding this, or are unable to complete registration but intend to do so prior to submitting your response to this notice, please inform the POC for this notice.? Invoicing and payment is intended to made through Wide Area Work Flow?{WAWF) and credit card. Once SAM registration is complete, please go to https://wawf.eb.mil/ to register for WAWF.? CAPABILITIES PACKAGE: All interested firms shall submit a capabilities package that explicitly demonstrates their capability to provide the required audio visual design and install services in accordance with the Draft Performance Work Statement. The capabilities package should be brief and concise, yet clearly demonstrate an ability to meet the stated requirements.? Responses may be submitted electronically to the following e-mail address: richard.bush.3@us.af.mil AND 501csw.rco@us.af.mil . All correspondence sent via email shall contain a subject line that reads??"FA557022Q1003, 501 CSW Vehicle Lease "?If this subject line is not included, the email may not get through email filters at RAF Alconbury. Filters are designed to delete emails without a subject or with a suspicious subject or attachments. Attachments with files ending in .zip or .exe are not allowable and will be deleted. Ensure only .pdf, .doc, .docx, .xsls or .xls documents are attached to your email. All other attachments may be deleted. Responses shall be emailed to: ? POC ? MSgt Richard Bush Email: richard.bush.3@us.af.mil AND? POC - TSgt Graham Staudt E-Mail: graham.staudt@us.af.mil AND 501st Combat Support Wing, Regional Contracting Office E-Mail:?501csw.rco@us.af.mil RESPONSES ARE DUE NOT LATER THAN 10 June 2022 at 12:00 PM Local Time (London). Direct all questions concerning this acquisition to MSgt Richard Bush at richard.bush.3@us.af.mil,???TSgt Graham Staudt at graham.staudt@us.af.mil and the 501 CSW, Regional Contracting Office?501csw.rco@us.af.mil .

category_id: Consulting: Insurance and Benefit Plan Bids
title: RFP for Workers’ Compensation Claims Third Party Administrator Services
description:
Request for Proposals (RFP) No. SFMTA-2022-31: Workers’ Compensation Claims Third Party Administrator Services

The City and County of San Francisco (City) is requesting proposals from qualified firms to provide third-party Workers’ Compensation claims administration for the San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency (SFMTA) and the City’s Department of Human Resources (DHR). Services shall include claims management, medical and disability benefits management, claims investigation, cost containment, litigation support/management, performance metrics, ancillary services, state reporting, and administrative management.

The City may award contracts to the Proposer that meets the Minimum Qualifications included in the Request for Proposals (RFP) and whose Proposal receives the highest-ranking score. The City intends to award two contracts to the highest-ranked Proposer: one for the management of DHR Claims, and another for management of SFMTA claims.  The contracts will have an initial term of three years, which the SFMTA or DHR may extend at their sole discretion for up to six additional years, for a total term of 9 years.

Proposers must provide documentation that clearly demonstrate that each RFP Minimum Qualification requirement has been met. Any Proposal that does not meet the RFP Minimum Qualifications requirements will be deemed non-responsive.

The City encourages Proposers to attend a virtual Pre-Proposal Conference via Microsoft Teams on May 19, 2022, at 1:00 PM PT. Proposers may register for the Pre-Proposal Conference and submit questions following the instructions included in RFP Section VI.A. The City will address Proposers’ questions and will provide any new or additional information concerning the RFP or selection process at the Pre-Proposal Conference.

The RFP and associated documents are attached to this Sourcing Event.  If you are interested in submitting a proposal, please follow the submission instructions provided in the RFP document.  Bids will not be accepted through the City and County of San Francisco's Supplier Portal website.
Event ID: SFGOV-0000006971

category_id: Consulting: Insurance and Benefit Plan Bids
title: Investment Advisory and General Pension Consultant
description: MSRP is an independent State of Maryland Agency. The MSRP Board of Trustees (the “Board”) was established under Title 35 of the State Personnel and Pensions Article of the Annotated Code of Maryland. Access to Title 35 is provided on the Maryland General Assembly website (http://mlis.state.md.us ). The Board has general oversight authority and fiduciary responsibility for certain tax-favored defined contribution plans (the “Plans”) for State employees. The Plans comprise the following: the 457(b) Plan; the 401(k) Plan; the 403(b) Plan; and the 401(a) Match Plan (each a “Plan” and collectively, the “Plans”).  MSRP’s Executive Director & Board Secretary is selected and appointed by the Board and is ultimately responsible for the daily management and oversight of the agency’s staff and operations.  The Board does not directly administer the Plans. The Executive Director and Deputy Executive Director & CFO supervise the third-party contractor Plan Administrator, advisors, and accountants. MSRP’s Member Services staff provides general education to State employees with respect to the benefits of participation in the Plans.

category_id: Consulting: Insurance and Benefit Plan Bids
title: Life Insurance and Accidental Death and Dismemberment, Optional Life Insurance and Accidental Death and Dismemberment, and Long-Term Disability
description: This Request for Proposals (“RFP” or “solicitation”) is soliciting Proposals from qualified Entities for The Office of Finance, Division of Payroll of the Baltimore Public Schools (City Schools) is responsible for administering the various benefits programs for City Schools’ employees and their dependents. The Material Management Office is issuing this Invitation for Bids (IFB) for a qualified insurance vendor(s) to provide basic life, basic and accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D), basic dependent life, optional life, and optional AD&D; and/or voluntary long-term disability (LTD) insurance benefit services and administration.

title: Disability Benefits Advocacy Project
description: The Department of Human Services (DHS or the Department) is issuing this Request for Proposals (RFP) in order to secure SSA Title II and Title XVI Benefits in two Functional Areas.  Functional Area I involves obtaining Title II and Title XVI benefits for children placed in foster care or recently emancipated youth up to the age of 23.  Functional Area II involves obtaining Title II and Title XVI benefits for DHS’s adult customers and Temporary Cash Assistance (TCA) children.

description: The Commonwealth seeks an Offeror to provide group life insurance to eligible employees in a nonparticipating contract according to the program requirements set forth by the Commonwealth statue, policy and collective bargaining agreements with labor unions. Terms and coverage are subject to multiple collective bargaining agreements with multiple labor organizations. title: Municipal Pension Contribution Data System
description:
Municipal Pension Contribution Data System
2022-RFP-132

The City of Pittsburgh is looking  to replace the current custom built Pension contribution application, and support biweekly pension contributions for approximately 3,500 + City and PWSA employees. The awarded vendor will also be tasked with migrating the current contribution database, containing approximately twenty thousand (20,000) records, from 1972 to date, which take up 2 gigabytes (GB) of space.

The awarded system will act as a replacement of the current customized Pension contribution application, and shall support biweekly pension contributions for approximately 3,500 City employees.

category_id: Consulting: Insurance and Benefit Plan Bids
title: Pharmacy Benefit Management Services
description:
Request for Proposals for Pharmacy Benefit Management Services

Solicitation ID: 21-11565-001

Status: Posted

Contact Name: Melissa Hassin

Contact Number: 512-867-7423

Contact Email: Melissa.Hassin@ers.texas.gov

Response Due Time: 10:00 AM

Response Due Date: 6/23/2022

Agency/Texas SmartBuy Member Number: 327

Solicitation Description:
EMPLOYEES RETIREMENT SYSTEM OF TEXAS

REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS TO PROVIDE PHARMACY BENEFIT MANAGEMENT SERVICES FOR THE HEALTHSELECT OF TEXAS PRESCRIPTION DRUG PROGRAM AND THE HEALTHSELECT MEDICARE RX PRESCRIPTION DRUG PROGRAM



SOLICITATION NO. 21-11565-001

NIGP CODE: 958-56





The Employees Retirement System of Texas (ERS) is issuing this Request for Proposals (RFP) seeking a qualified pharmacy benefit manager (PBM) to provide the following services under the Texas Employees Group Benefits Program:

a)         Pharmacy benefit management services for the HealthSelect of Texas® Prescription Drug Program (HealthSelect PDP). HealthSelect PDP is a prescription drug program for non-Medicare-primary Participants enrolled in HealthSelect of Texas, a self-funded, managed care, point-of-service health plan; HealthSelectSM Out-of-State; and Consumer Directed HealthSelectSM, a high-deductible health plan paired with a health savings account; and

b)         Pharmacy benefit management services for the HealthSelect Medicare Rx Prescription Drug Program (HealthSelect Medicare Rx PDP). HealthSelect Medicare Rx PDP is a Medicare prescription drug program for Medicare-primary Participants enrolled in HealthSelectSM Medicare Advantage, a preferred provider organization, and HealthSelectSM Secondary. HealthSelect Medicare Rx PDP is a Medicare Part D Employer Group Waiver Plan plus Wrap.

ERS will only select one (1) Respondent to provide the pharmacy benefit management services (Services) for both HealthSelect PDP and HealthSelect Medicare Rx PDP. ERS will execute a Contract with PBM and PBM will be responsible for its performance under the Contract. ERS reserves the right not to select any Respondent to provide the Services.

Respondent shall provide the level of services required in the RFP and meet other requirements that are in the best interests of ERS, its members, and the state of Texas (State). Respondent shall be required to execute a contract (Contract) provided by, and satisfactory to, ERS for a period that begins upon execution of the Contract by ERS and, after the implementation period, extend through December 31, 2029, subject to the terms of the Contract. It is anticipated the Contract will be executed in December 2022.

The Confidentiality and Nondisclosure Agreement, attached to the RFP as Appendix E (NDA,) must be properly executed per the instructions found in RFP Sections I.E.7. - I.E.7.a. in order to receive ERS’ Experience Data and File Layouts (Appendices S, T, and U). 

To ask questions, download the RFP, submit an NDA, Minimum Requirements Questionnaire and/or a Proposal, prospective Respondents must first create a profile in Bonfire (ERS’ e-procurement portal located at erstexas.bonfirehub.com), which operates best on the latest versions of Microsoft Edge, Google Chrome, and Mozilla Firefox. Browser cookies must be enabled when accessing Bonfire.

Questions will be accepted via Bonfire regarding the Minimum Requirements Questionnaire until May 18, 2022 at 4:00 p.m. CT and regarding the RFP until June 1, 2020 at 4:00 p.m. CT. Answers to questions will be posted to Bonfire and ESBD on the date specified in RFP Section I.B.1.

To be eligible for consideration, Respondent is required to submit its Minimum Requirement Questionnaire and Proposal in accordance with the instructions set forth in the RFP and Bonfire. The Minimum Requirements Questionnaire shall be received by ERS no later than June 13, 2022 at 10:00 a.m. CT. All Proposal materials shall be received by ERS via Bonfire no later than June 23, 2022 at 10:00 a.m. CT. Any Respondent wishing to submit a Proposal shall meet the Minimum Requirements set forth in the Minimum Requirements Questionnaire (Appendix H).

ERS reserves the right to rebid the RFP if deemed by ERS to be in the best interests of ERS, its members, and/or the State. ERS also reserves the right to reject any Proposal submitted that does not fully comply with the RFP’s instructions and criteria. ERS is under no legal requirement to execute a Contract on the basis of this notice or upon issuance of the RFP and will not pay any costs incurred by any Respondent in connection with the preparation of a Proposal. ERS also reserves the right to revise any provisions set forth in the RFP at any time prior to execution of a Contract where ERS deems it to be in the best interests of ERS, its members, and/or the State.

Any general questions should be sent to ERS’ point of contact, Melissa Hassin, Procurement Specialist, via Bonfire or ivendorquestions@ers.texas.gov. ERS’ mailing address is P.O. Box 13207, Austin, Texas 78711-3207

category_id: Consulting: Insurance and Benefit Plan Bids
title: STAR PLUS Managed Care Services
description:
STAR PLUS Managed Care Services

Solicitation ID: HHS0011062

Status: Posted

Contact Name: Jason Ochoa

Contact Number: 512-406-2572

Contact Email: Jason.Ochoa@hhs.texas.gov

Response Due Time: 10:30 AM

Response Due Date: 6/2/2022

Agency/Texas SmartBuy Member Number: 529

Solicitation Description:
STAR+PLUS is a Texas Medicaid managed care program integrating the delivery of Acute Care Services and Long-Term Services and Supports (LTSS). The STAR+PLUS Program operates under Section 1115 of the Social Security Act as part of a demonstration project and Section 1915 of the Social Security Act as part of the Texas § 1915 (c) waivers to expand the Medicaid managed care delivery system statewide and provide home and Community-Based Services under a Medicaid managed care model.

HHSC will require managed care organizations submitting proposals for STAR+PLUS to also submit a Notice of Intent to Apply for a Dual Eligible Special Needs Plan (D-SNP) contract to the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) by November 2022, in accordance with the CMS Medicare Part C application deadlines. MCOs should refer to the STAR+PLUS Request for Proposals for additional information.

The Dual Demonstration is authorized by HHSC and the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) to operate through December 2022, with plans for renewal through December 2023. HHSC and CMS are discussing further authorization. If the Texas Medicare-Medicaid Dual Demonstration is continued beyond 2023, then HHSC will require managed care organizations submitting proposals for STAR+PLUS to also submit a Notice of Intent to Apply for a Dual Eligible Special Needs Plan (D-SNP) contract or a Dual Eligibles Medicare-Medicaid Plan (MMP) contract to the CMS by November 2022, in accordance with the CMS Medicare Part C application deadlines and to be effective by January 2024.

***ATTENTION: Visit www.loudoun.gov/procurement to download the full solicitation for full details on the submission process. Online responses are not accepted. 
 The intent of the Request for Proposal (RFP) is to obtain the services of a qualified firm to provide actuarial consulting and/or administrative services for the Volunteer Fire/Rescue Length of Service Award Program (“LOSAP”). Firms may propose on both the actuarial consulting and administrative services, or just one service. The County reserves the right to award the contract in whole or by service, whichever is most advantageous to the County.

category_id: Consulting: Insurance and Benefit Plan Bids
title: Industry Day for OWCP Medical Physician Network and Medical Bill Processing Services
description: OVERVIEW: The Department of Labor (DOL) is continuing to conduct market research on industry?s capabilities to provide nationwide medical provider services by means of a provider network or networks, and to serve as a third-party biller to receive and process medical bills according to industry standards and OWCP rules (where necessary).? A virtual Industry Day is planned for June 23, 2022, to discuss the Government?s current, revised objectives for services and industry?s capabilities and standard processes. This notice is in follow-up to the Sources Sought/Request for Information (RFI) #1638-DFC-21-NAT-0001 previously posted in July 2021.? The objectives are substantively changed from the prior RFI to remove Directed Medical Services and alter the requirements related to the provider network. The current, revised Statement of Objectives (SOO) is attached to this notice. INDUSTRY DAY DETAILS: The June 23rd Industry Day will be held virtually via a platform such a Microsoft Teams, WebEx or Zoom.? It is expected to last between three (3) and four (4) hours.? The time of and a link to the event will follow the RSVP period.? Unless otherwise instructed at the time of response, the Government intends to promote networking among interested vendors and other Industry Day attendees by sharing the names and contact information of all registered attendees. The Government is seeking feedback on OWCP?s latest objectives, and to better understand current industry capabilities and common practices in medical networks and medical bill processing. The Government is also seeking to explore alternative Contract Line Item Number (CLIN) structures based on specific objectives within the SOO. At a high level, the Industry Day agenda will include opening statements by the DOL Office of Acquisition Services and Office of Small Disadvantaged Business Utilization, an overview of OWCP objectives for MPN-MBP services, discussion of commonalities and differences between the OWCP programs? service needs, and a question-and-answer period for additional conversation. DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION, ACCESSIBILITY (DEIA): Obtaining a diverse pool of medical services providers is an important part of the requirements in contracts for medical services for OWCP.? The provision below is included in the MPN-MBP SOO.? It requires the contractor to utilize as diverse a group of medical service providers as practicable.? The satisfactory performance of services, and improvements in treatment outcomes, depends in part on overcoming barriers to access to medical services by underserved communities. SOO Provision:? Advancing Equity in the Pool of Medical Service Providers Supporting OWCP? In accordance with the statutes and regulations governing OWCP, including 5 U.S.C. Section 8103, implementing regulations at 20 C.F.R. Sections 10.300?et seq., as well as Executive Order (E.O.) 13985, which orders federal agency heads to advance diversity, equity, inclusion and accessibility, the contractor shall to the greatest extent practicable provide a diverse pool of medical service providers and shall adopt policies and practices for the engagement of medical service providers (whether through hiring as employees, by subcontracting, or otherwise) that promote fair, just, and impartial treatment of all individuals.? The contractor shall advance equity in the process of hiring and/or subcontracting for medical service providers and shall take steps to overcome barriers that underserved communities and individuals may face in accessing medical services under OWCP programs.? In order to accomplish this, the contractor should conduct outreach to underserved communities with respect to employment and subcontracting opportunities, to include, among other things, working with affinity groups, colleges and universities, minority serving educational institutions, and other similar organizations, e.g., National Black Chamber of Commerce, Asian Pacific Partners for Empowerment, Advocacy & Leadership, the U.S. Hispanic Chambers of Commerce,? Hispanic Associations of Colleges and Universities (HACUs), Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs), and Tribal Colleges and Universities (TCUs). The contractor understands and agrees to the following:? That advancing equity in the pool of medical service providers, and in the provision of medical services, will have a positive impact on the delivery of the services required under this contract; that many disparities exist in the diagnosis and treatment of pain (and other symptoms, conditions) between persons of various backgrounds, due to factors such as language barriers, and socio-economic status; these disparities manifest not only in whether and how pain is perceived and communicated by individuals, but also in the clinical assessment and treatment of pain when reported by members of different communities; that the contractor?s efforts to advance diversity in the pool of medical service providers are important and necessary to overcome barriers to access by underserved communities in the diagnosis and treatment of pain, and to improve treatment outcomes for all under this contract.? Contractors must submit a monthly Medical Service Provider Diversity report.? The report must include a description of the contractor?s efforts to advance equity in the engagement of medical service providers that perform work under this contract, including efforts by subcontractors.? The report must also state the number of individuals from underserved communities that are providing medical services in support of this contract, and their geographic location within the country. This requirement shall apply to subcontractors at all tiers who perform medical services under this contract and a similar requirement must be included in every subcontract at any tier. The terms ?underserved communities,? ?diversity,? ?equity,? ?inclusion? and ?accessibility,? as used in this provision have the same definition as in E.O. 13985. HOW TO RESPOND: Please provide an RSVP by June 7, 2022, at 12p.m. Eastern Daylight Time (EDT) to the Industry Day POC?s.? Include the attendee name(s) and contact information that may be shared with other attendees for networking purposes.? Also include any questions to the Government about the current, revised SOO. INDUSTRY DAY POINT OF CONTACTS: Tomeka Evans Contracting Officer Email: Evans.Tomeks.S@dol.gov DaVeana Johnson Contract Specialist Email: Johnson.DaVeana@dol.gov Anthony Gardner Program Analyst Email: Gardner.Anthony.J@dol.gov? Gary Small Program Analyst Email: Small.Gary.D@dol.gov

category_id: Consulting: Insurance and Benefit Plan Bids
title: Local Area Set-Aside (FAR 26.2) Life Insurance Coverage for Local Employed Staff of U.S. Mission Morocco
description: The Government of the United States of America requires group life insurance coverage for its employees, as further described in C.2.2, in Morocco. ?The Government has determined that the prevailing practice by employers in Morocco is that group life insurance coverage is representative of locally prevailing compensation practice and that the cost of such insurance protection is usually borne 100% by the employer. Therefore, the Government desires to adopt such locally prevailing practice as part of its compensation plan for its employees as further described in C.2.2.? The specific group insurance coverage under this contract is set forth below and in Section J.

The contractor shall also pay a portion of gross advertising revenue to the City. Currently, the City receives fifteen (15%) of gross advertising revenue. The contractor is free to propose alternative revenue package enhancements/options. However, the City is generally focused upon maintaining receipt of at least fifteen (15%) of gross advertising revenue.

description: THIS IS NOT A SOLICITATION: In accordance with FAR Part 10, Market Research, this is a Sources Sought to determine the availability of potential sources/vendors having the skills and capabilities necessary to provide temporary housing for homeless veterans for single males for the Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center located at 1500 Weiss, Saginaw, Michigan 48602. All interested contractors are invited to provide information to contribute to this market survey/Sources Sought including, commercial market information. This Sources Sought notice is for information and planning purposes only and shall not be construed as a solicitation or as an obligation on the part of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). The VA is currently conducting market research to locate qualified, experienced, and interested potential sources relative to NAICS 624221. Responses will not be considered as proposals, nor will any award be incurred by interested parties in responding to this Sources Sought announcement.

title: Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) Set-Aside (FAR 19.14): G004--Healthcare for Homeless Veterans (HCHV)  PHILADELPHIA
description: This is a Combined Synopsis/Solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, Streamlined Procedures for Evaluation and Solicitation for Commercial Items. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. The combined synopsis solicitation number is 36C24422Q0248. It is issued as a Request for Proposal (RFP). The government anticipates awarding one five-year firm-fixed price Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract resulting from this solicitation. This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 20222-06 (5/1/2022) and can be found at http://www.acquisition.gov/far/index.html. The North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 624221, Temporary Shelters, with a small business size standard of $12 Million. This solicitation is 100% SDVOSB set-aside. The Department of Veteran Affairs Corporal Michael J. Crescenz Veterans Affairs Medical Center, CMCVAMC is located at 3900 Woodland Avenue, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 19104, is seeking to award a five-year Indefinite Delivery / Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract. This contract requires the Contractor to provide a 24-hours a day / 7 days a week (24/7) community-based early recovery model through a Safe Haven model of residential care at a facility located within the city of Philadelphia and accessible by public transportation that serves homeless Veterans, including those with serious mental illness, physical disabilities, and substance use disorders. CMCVAMC requires two separate programs that serve two distinct levels of Healthcare for Homeless Veterans (HCHV) Contracted Residential Services (CRS), as outlined below in accordance with VHA Handbook 1162.09. Contract will provide emergency residential placement and treatment services through the Health Care for Homeless Veterans (HCHV) program for a total 45 homeless Veterans in two separate programs who need immediate placement in a safe environment with onsite treatment services. The target population for this HCHV Contracted Residential Services is chronically homeless, chronically mentally ill Veterans, Veterans with chronic substance abuse disorders and complex needs. The goal of the HCHV Contracted Residential Services is to remove homeless Veterans from the street or habitation unfit for Veterans, rapidly stabilize Veterans medical, mental health, substance abuse, and other psychosocial problems in order to place Veterans in other appropriate transitional or permanent housing. Contractor will provide rapid placement of VA-referred Veterans in a safe, residential treatment setting while addressing Veterans complex needs through on-site treatment case management services. This housing must meet the criteria established by HCHV clinical staff, VA fire and safety officials. Contractors are urged in the strongest terms to carefully review the requirements outlined in the Performance Work Statement to ensure that all facilities fire and safety and treatment services criteria can be met in a timely way.

title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): J--Firetruck service/maintenance
description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is W91ZRS22R0016 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 922160 with a small business size standard of 0.00 employees. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified sellers may submit bids. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-06-07 14:00:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be East Lyme, , CT 06333 The National Guard - Connecticut requires the following items, Meet or Exceed, to the following: LI 001: 1. NFPA 1911 ? Annual Fire Apparatus Pump Services ? 4 TRUCKS ? To be performed at service center ? Check all fluid levels prior to starting test ? Throttle and Engine Operation ? Run Priming Pump-22in ? Pressure Relief Control test ? Dry Vacuum Test (Maxim drop 10in in 5min) ? Pressure Gauge and Flow Meter test ? Tank to Pump Flow Check ? Provide Written Test Report For compliance for ISO ? Inspections, services, and repairs of electrical and CPU truck components must be performed by an authorized Pierce Manufacturing Emergency Vehicle Service Center Please see attached SOW for specifications., 1, JOB; LI 002: 2. NFPA 1982 Annual Service For Self-Contained Breathing Apparatus ? Can be performed at Service Center or at Firehouse ? Hydrostatic testing with recharge of all SCBA cylinders & new ?O? rings ? Visual Inspection ? Functions Test ? Alarm Test ? Gauge Test ? Scott 4.5 air-packs repaired & functional tested ? Annual FIT Testing ? Repair or Replacement of SCBA system and associated parts Please see attached SOW for specifications., 1, JOB; LI 003: 3. NFPA 1932 Annual Service for Ground Ladders ? 6 Ladders ? Can be performed at Service Center or at Firehouse ? Horizontal Bend Test ? Heat Sensor Inspection ? Hardware Test ? Load Test Please see attached SOW for specifications., 1, JOB; LI 004: 4. NFPA 1962 Annual Service for Fire Hoses 128EA - 6,400 total Feet ? Can be performed at Service Center or at Firehouse ? Attack Hose pressure test up to 300 PSI ? Supply Hose pressure test up to 200 PSI ? Visual Test ? Included but not limited to maintaining, replacing, or servicing all nozzles, fittings, couplings, and gaskets. Please see attached SOW for specifications., 1, JOB; LI 005: 5. NFPA 1901 Quarterly Cascade System Services ? Must be performed at Firehouse, Cascade System is permanently mounted inside building ? Perform quarterly service on 1EA UN III 25H-E3 Compressor o Service includes but not limited to labor, change oil, purification cartridges, check auto drain system, drive belts, startup & shutdown pressure, look for oil & air leaks and loose hardware. ? Perform quarterly service on 2EA Portable Compressors o Service includes but not limited to labor, change oil, purification cartridges, check auto drain system, drive belts, startup & shutdown pressure, look for oil & air leaks and loose hardware. Please see attached SOW for specifications., 1, JOB; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested Offerers must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, National Guard - Connecticut intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. National Guard - Connecticut is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerers that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerers that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerers that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerers may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should Offerers require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. Closest location within CT, MA, and R.I. preferred and please state if all services can be done at Firehouse. New Equipment ONLY; NO remanufactured or "gray market" items. All items must be covered by the manufacturer's warranty. Bid MUST be good for 30 calendar days after close of Buy. Shipping must be free on board (FOB) destination CONUS (Continental U.S.), which means that the seller must deliver the goods on its conveyance at the destination specified by the buyer, and the seller is responsible for the cost of shipping and risk of loss prior to actual delivery at the specified destination. This solicitation requires registration with the System for Award Management (SAM) in order to be considered for award, pursuant to applicable regulations and guidelines. Registration information can be found at www.sam.gov. Registration must be "ACTIVE" at the time of award. The selected Offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions, which are incorporated herein by reference: FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition; FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications - Commercial Items - the selected offeror must submit a completed copy of the listed representations and certifications; FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items; FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, paragraph (a) and the following clauses in paragraph (b): 52.222-21, 52.222-26, 52.222-35, 52.222-36, 52.222-37, 52.225-13, 52.232-34. The full text of the referenced FAR clauses may be accessed electronically at https://www.acquisition.gov/far/.

category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: Plumbing, Piping, Fire Protection Service Bids
title: High Density Polyethylene (HDPE) Pipe & Fitting
description: The Clayton County Water Authority will open sealed bids from licensed contractors via a Virtual Teams Meeting on Tuesday, June 7, 2022, at 2:00 p.m. local time for High Density Polyethylene (HDPE) Pipe and Fittings. Any bids received after the specified time will not be considered. A Non-Mandatory Pre-Bid Virtual Teams Meeting will be held on Tuesday, May 24, 2022, at 2:00 p.m. local time. Please use the following call-in instructions to attend the Pre-Bid and Bid Opening meetings: Join Microsoft Teams Meeting Dial Phone Number: 912-483-5368 Phone Conference ID: 589 613 421# CCWA encourages Small Local, Minority and Women-Owned businesses to participate and respond to this bid request. To promote responsible environmental practices the bid package is available in electronic (Adobe PDF) format and can be requested via e-mail at CCWA_Procurement@ccwa.us, or by calling 770-960-5223, M-F, 8:00 am - 5:00 pm. Bidders will need to provide contact information and an email address and any file size transfer limits to ensure email transmittals can be made. A hardcopy bid package can also be requested at a cost of $25.

category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: Plumbing, Piping, Fire Protection Service Bids
title: Trade Contractors at Risk for the Renovations - Plumbing
description:
Request for Qualifications # 22109

For Trade Contractors at Risk for the Renovations to the Gloucester Police Station and District Court.

The City of Gloucester seeks proposals from qualified Trade contractors interested in being prequalified for the Renovations to the Gloucester Police Station and District Court. Trade Contractor Statement of Qualifications Forms from interested trade subcontractors are sought for the following categories of work: Masonry, Resilient Flooring, Miscellaneous Metals, Acoustic Ceilings, Waterproofing Damproofing & Caulking, Painting, Metal Windows, Fire Sprinklers, Glass and Glazing, Plumbing Ceramic Tile, Heating, Ventilation & Air Conditioning, Electrical. The RFQ package will be available on April 13, 2022 by emailing purchasing@gloucester-ma.gov or at the Office of the Purchasing Agent.  Proposals must be received and will be opened at Construction Monitoring Services, Inc. 270 Main Street, Marlborough, MA  01752 no later than 11:00 a.m. on May 5, 2022. This Request for Qualifications (“RFQ”) is the first phase of a two-phase procurement process as set forth in MGL Chapter 149A. Only prequalified firms with DCAMM certification will be permitted to submit bids for the above categories.  The City reserves the right to reject any and all proposals or to accept that which is deemed in the best interest of the City of Gloucester, MA.  The City shall not be responsible for proposals arriving late for any reason.

category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: Plumbing, Piping, Fire Protection Service Bids
title: Renovate Latrines, Showers, and Tuck-Pointing
description:
T2133-01 
Renovate Latrines, Showers, and Tuck-Pointing - Cape Girardeau Readiness Center
The project includes the addition and alterations to the Missouri national Guard RC Building. Demolition of existing men’s and women’s
 showers, latrines and locker areas, including adjoining spaces for renovation and
 of new latrines, showers and locker areas. New finishes include resinous flooring
 and wall coverings, lay-in ceilings, and HPDE toilet and shower partitions.
 Exterior maintenance of the masonry veneer includes, cleaning, tuckpointing, and
 installation of water repellant.

End Date: Jun 02, 2022 

Contact Information
Solicitation Number :T2133-01 from OA - FMDC - Contracts Chapter 8
Tunde (April) Howser
 301 W High St Room 730 Jefferson City MO, 65101 United States
 Tel: 573-751-0053

title: Upgrade Latrines, Showers
description:
T2136-01 
Upgrade Latrines, Showers, and Exterior Paving - Farmington Readiness Center
The Project includes demolition of existing men’s and women’s showers, latrines and locker areas, including adjoining spaces for renovation and of new latrines, showers and locker areas. New finishes include resinous flooring and wall coverings, lay-in ceilings, and HPDE toilet and shower partitions. Replacement of the exterior paving at the rear entrance to remediate stormwater drainage issues. **See "HOW TO ACQUIRE PLANS AND SPECIFICATIONS" below for a hyperlink to the view-only electronic specifications for this project.**
End Date: Jun 09, 2022

title: Backflow Inspections and Irrigation Repairs
description:
Bid Number: 	PRP 22-13
Bid Title: 	Backflow Inspections and Irrigation Repairs
Category: 	Plumbing
Status: 	Open

Description:

The City of University City is requesting bids from qualified contractors to provide all labor and materials necessary to perform annual backflow device inspections/testing/repairs and irrigation repairs as needed.  The successful bidder will also be required to file all reports and associated paperwork on behalf of the City of University City to the St. Louis County Public Works Department. The repairs will be completed on a time and material basis.
Publication Date/Time:
5/20/2022 10:00 AM
Closing Date/Time:
